content.description: On the left of the obvious Burner Run Roof. Starts up blocky terrain aiming left for the corner and ledge. Follow corner to top.
content.protection: Standard rack, finish at large tree on right.
content.location: Far left side of cliffband.  Left side of large overhang.(Bruner Run Roof)

content.description: Climb up moderate 5.8 face holds to the first clip.  Continue up the bolt line on flakes and face holds to a large horizontal. Finishes on  larger holds above.  Steep and continuous from the first bolt up to the top.
content.location: Face to the right of Piton Corner

content.description: Begin 12' right of Easier Said than Done on the red streak. Follow the red streak up the bolt line, finishing on headwall above.
content.location: Easy to see. Follows red streak to the right of Easier Said Than Done.

content.description: Climb the inside dirty corner up past 2 pitons to the top. Better than it looks.
content.protection: Standard trad rack.  Ring shuts on left at top.  You'll find an old rusty piton in the bottom inside corner and a newer, more solid pin near top with a sling.
content.location: Inside corner to the right of Bruner Run Roof.

content.description: Climbs the arete feature.  Technical and balancy.  Sustained in nature. Crux above 3rd bolt
content.location: Right side of the crag. Bolts painted a tan color. First line on right upon reaching the cliff.

content.description: Starts to the right of the fallen tree leaning against the rock (under the small roof 10' up). Work left under the overhang until possible to gain the obvious roof crack/flake. Power up over the flake and climb the easy 5.5 face to the top.
Start in the corner in front of Lunch rock. Follow the corner system up through bulges and the slightly overhanging face to the top.
content.protection: 4 bolts; ring shuts   Mixed route- need gear between bolts 3 & 4
content.location: Right in front of the Lunch Rock.

content.description: Starts under low overhang.  Pull up into overhanging open book corner. Figure it out to the top.
content.protection: Toprope, shuts with snap-links and red biners at the lip.  Rap down to use when top roping.  Rigging from here prevents rope abrasion.  Please do not remove the red biners.
content.location: Left of lunch rock. Obvious line.

content.description: Starts below obvious flake 10' right of O'Brien's Line. Work up through balancy feet and a powerful reach to the flake over head. Move right around arete. Finish on overhanging face.
Climbs the roof on the left side of the overhang at its weakest point. Climb up the blocky face to the base of the roof. Pull through the roof. Finish in the corner above.
content.location: 15' right of Trundle Queen.  Near left end of cliff.

content.description: A micro tcu will "protect"...lol (fair warning) up to the first bolt. Bolt clipper friendly from there. Spicy start...proceed with caution ⚠️
content.protection: Mixed start. Bolts to top from there.

content.description: A nice easily accessible crag located right by the Bruner Run take-out area for the Lower Yough River.  Located apprx. 7.5miles downstream from Ohiopyle.  This crag sport a bunch of nice face climbs of varying difficulty.  One of the top choices here is O'Brien's line which was put up by local river guide Kevin O'Brien in the late 80's.  Other high quality lines exist here as well as several moderate trad climbs for the aspiring trad leader.  Definitely worth visiting and can be combined with the other Ohiopyle crags just upstream from the parking area.
